title:
Self energy in Kerr-Sen space-time incorporated to overspinning and
  overcharging problems
abstract:
Previously, it was shown that Kerr-Sen black holes can be overcharged or
overspun into naked singularities neglecting backreaction effects. Here, we
re-evaluate the overspinning and overcharging problems incorporating the self
energy of the perturbations due to the induced increase in the angular velocity
and the electrostatic potential of the event horizon described in a seminal
work by Will. We show that Kerr-Sen black holes cannot be overspun or
overcharged by perturbations satisfying the null energy condition in a complete
second order analysis which comprises the self-energy of the perturbations.
